projectPurpose: To provide a robust, open-source library implementation of the QUIC transport protocol and the HTTP/3 layer, offering low-level control and high-level HTTP/3 functionality for integration into various applications.
platforms: Cross-platform (as a library, underlying application dictates OS support)
mainFeatures: Implementation of IETF QUIC and HTTP/3
Low-level API for packet processing and connection state
C FFI for integration with other languages
Support for various congestion control algorithms
Supports 0-RTT (Zero Round-Trip Time) connection resumption (with BoringSSL)

alternatives.name: Google QUICHE (Chromium)
mainFeatures: Powers QUIC and HTTP/3 in Chrome

alternatives.name: aioquic
mainFeatures: QUIC and HTTP/3 library in Python

marketPositioning: Quiche is positioned as a high-performance, open-source library for implementing the QUIC and HTTP/3 protocols. Developed by Cloudflare, it offers both low-level network control and higher-level HTTP/3 functionality, written in Rust for safety and performance, with a C FFI for broad compatibility. Its use in Cloudflare's production environment demonstrates its capability for demanding applications, setting it apart as a credible and actively maintained foundational library for developers building next-generation network services.
